results.title: Atom and agriculture
results.brief_description: The importance, types and principal uses of radio-active isotopes in agricultural research; radio-active cobalt and calcium used to study growth and hereditary characteristics in plants; radio-active carbon-dioxide used to study the chemistry of food production; radio-sulphur used in the study of wool growth; use of radio-active calcium and phosphorous in research work on egg production. No other credits available.

results.title: Atoll life in Kiribati
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Cinema Enterprises and Oliver Howes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human face of the Pacific”.
This series of films examines traditional lifestyles on the different Pacific islands. This particular film looks at the traditions observed by the 64,000 people who live on the sixteen islands of Kiribati.

results.title: Atmospheric science
results.creator_credit: Coronet, Bill Walker Productions, Joel Marks and Mel Waskin
results.brief_description: Dramatic cinematography and timelapse photography convey the drama of nature’s spectacular display. ‘Global winds’ demonstrates global circulation and how these movements depend on great convection cells set in motion by differences in temperature. ‘Clouds and precipitation’ looks at how clouds form and vanish and explains the differences between the types of clouds we see. ‘Violent storms’ examines the causes and effects of thunderstorms, thunderheads and tornadoes. Suitable for Upper Primary and Secondary level students.

results.title: Atmosphere in motion. - Revised edition.
results.brief_description: Recent changes in the ozone layer have refocused attention on the importance of the atmosphere to life on our planet. Pictures from space show the swirling wisps and bands in the mass of air surrounding the Earth. Convection cells, the Coriolis Effect, the structure and composition of the atmosphere, and the invisible forces that keep the atmosphere in continuous motion are illustrated through demonstrations, laboratory experiments and animation. A well presented introduction to the atmosphere which is ideal for background information on the Greenhouse effect.

results.title: Atmosphere in motion
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and William Kay
results.brief_description: Explores the causes and effects of atmospheric motion. Time-lapse photography makes the ordinarily slow movement of clouds readily observable and uses experiments to illustrate and explain other atmospheric phenomena.

results.title: Atmosphere and its circulation
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the nature of air, showing its structure, chemical composition, weight and distribution. Its circulation in relation to the Earth, how circulation forms pressure bands and is affected by rotation of the Earth, causing movement or winds; the structure and dynamics of atmosphere are studied with the aid of animated diagrams. No other credits available.

results.title: Atlantic trawler
results.creator_credit: Realist Films, Great Britain. Ministry of Information, John Taylor and Frank Sainsbury
results.brief_description: Life aboard a fishing trawler off the West Coast of England, under arduous and dangerous war-time conditions. Shows the daily life of the crew at sea, consisting of fishing day and night and hauling every three or four hours. Also looks at life on land as women repair nets, clean fish and greet their returning husbands. Tragically, the steam trawler ‘Hondo’ on which this documentary was filmed returned to sea with a different crew and was lost with all hands. Photographed by A. E. Jenkins, Chick Fowle and Cyril Phillips. Sound by Ken Cameron and Jock May. Music by William Alwyn.

results.title: Atlantic parks = Parcs Atlantique
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jacques Bobet and Andre Belleau
results.brief_description: An exploration of three of Canada’s National Parks; Fundy, Prince Edward Island and Cape Breton Highlands, all on the Atlantic coast, where, by filmmaker’s licence’ boy meets girl, marries and has a family, all while enjoying the park’s many other rewards for autocampers. Even the girl’s little white car, which leads us to the parks at the outset, seems to run on the pure air and the anticipation of fresh adventures around the next turn.

results.title: Atlantic link
results.creator_credit: Film Producers Guild and Jack Greenwood
results.brief_description: This film traces the laying of the first transatlantic submarine telephone cable, made possible by the cooperation of technologists and engineers in the United Kingdom, the United States and Canada. Describes the routing of landlines on both sides of the Atlantic; the drama and precision involved in the laying of cables between Britain and Newfoundland.
results.description: This film traces the laying of the first transatlantic submarine telephone cable, made possible by the cooperation of technologists and engineers in the United Kingdom, the United States and Canada.
